about_donate_text.message: If you found the utility useful, please consider supporting its development by donating.

about_application_built_with_text.message: This application was built using web technologies - xhtml / css / javascript

default_optional_permissions_text.message: Due to the nature of arduino leonardo bootloader design, Configurator requires additional USB permissions to be able to restart ATmega32u4 based hardware.

default_voltage_warning_text.message:
Please note that only certain openLRS units can operate with 5V USB-serial adapter.
It is strongly suggested to always use 3.3V USB-serial adapter.

Permanent damage is caused immediately by powering non compatible units with 5V.

default_open_source_text.message:
This utility is fully open source and is available free of charge to all openLRSng users.
If you found the utility useful, please consider supporting its development by donating.

firmware_uploader_file_limit_exceeded.message: File limit (1 MB) exceeded, aborting

firmware_uploader_hex_file_corrupted.message: HEX file appears to be corrupted

firmware_uploader_can_not_flash_corrupte.message: Can not flash corrupted firmware, please select different HEX file or re-select board to load embedded firmware

firmware_uploader_no_startup_message_rec.message: Startup message not received withing 10 seconds, Auto Update failed

firmware_uploader_already_running_latest.message: You are already running the latest firmware

firmware_uploader_firmware_uploader_inst.message:
1. Connect your TX or RX module via usb to serial dongle to the computer (with DTR)
2. Selected desired firmware for your module
3. Press "Flash Firmware" and wait for process to finish
4. You are done

Note: Auto-Connect and Connect button is always disabled in firmware flasher.

firmware_uploader_firmware_uploader_flas.message:
1. Select Board
2. Click on Load Custom Firmware button
3. Firmware Info should display general info about custom firmware (type / size)
4. Click on Flash Firmware button

Note: Custom Firmware can only be flashed when specific board/module is selected

options_disable_quickjoin.description: This feature is recommended to be enabled at all times

options_improve_configurator.message: Send anonymous usage data to the developer team

rx_module_note_text.message: Receiver tries to connect on startup for 0.5 second, if this fails try bridging Port-1 and Port-2 on your receiver with a jumper.

rx_module_please_wait.message: Please wait for the TX module to establish connection with the RX module.

rx_failsafe_checkbox_lock_failsafe.message: Lock failsafe value for this channel (pressing failsafe button on the module won't overwrite the value)

rx_failsafe_info_text.message:
Failsafe values have non-uniform resolution: 800 - 1000 = 16 us / 1000 - 2000 = 1 us / 2000 - 2200 = 16 us

Set - enable failsafe on channel, unset channels will retain last state
Lock - prevent changing failsafe info by TX unit F/S button

rx_module_try_to_establish_connection.message: Trying to establish connection with the RX module

rx_module_connection_established_ok.message: Connection to the receiver module successfully established

rx_module_connection_timed_out.message: Connection to the RX module timed out

rx_module_connection_timed_out_retrying.message: Connection to the RX module timed out, retrying

rx_module_faulty_response.message: Failed response from the RX module

rx_module_connection_request_canceled.message: Connection request to the RX module was canceled

rx_module_configuration_restored.message: Configuration successfully restored from file

rx_module_data_structure_invalid.message: Data structure invalid (backup file was probably generated for older version of configurator)

rx_module_incorrect_data_structure.message: Incorrect / Corrupted data structure detected

rx_module_validation_failed_message_2.message: Please try to enter appropriate value, otherwise you won't be able to save settings in EEPROM

rx_module_always_bind_on_startup_title.message: If you disable this function, you have to use jumper to bridge port 1 and 2 to re-enter this menu or to bind again

rx_module_immediate_output_title.message: Instantly output PWM/PPM (before link is established), failsafe needs to be set

rx_module_static_beacon_title.message: Emit single tone at full power instead of fading tune.

rx_module_watchdog_title.message: Watchdog is enabled automatically when using optiboot as bootloader

signal_monitor_info.message: This screen will display channel values from PPM input if valid PPM data is received, Spektrum/SBUS/SUMD cannot be monitored.

troubleshooting_text_1.message:
Windows (XP/Vista/7/8/8.1)
Software is fully compatible.
Linux
1. You need to add yourself to "dialout" group to allow chrome/chromium serial port access.
FIX: You can do so by executing: sudo usermod -aG dialout YOUR_USERNAME, relog or reboot is required afterwards.
Mac OS
Software wasn't fully tested on this platform.
Chrome OS
Software wasn't fully tested on this platform.

troubleshooting_text_2.message:
Deluxe TX is based on Atmega32u4 chip, which have usb support directly on the chip (no serial to usb dongle required).

Because of this hardware "setup" configurator requires optional USB permissions to restart the module before connecting.
This means, that you won't be able to connect to this module unless you allow configurator to access USB devices.

troubleshooting_head_3.message: Installing and using old versions of configurator

troubleshooting_text_3.message:
openLRSng - configurator installed from google store auto-updates when new version is released (there is no way around it).
In some cases bugfixes and newly implemented features break backwards compatibility, however there might be cases when you would like to stay on an older version.

1. openLRSng - configurator releases - download older configurator version (you can view embedded firmware version by clicking on "..."
2. unzip downloaded zipfile
3. in google chrome, go to "tools -> extensions"
4. check the "Developer mode" checkbox
5. click on "Load unpacked extension" and load the unzipped folder
